title: Basque Tutorial
text:
Introduce Yourself in Basque!



Basque Flag




To tell someone your name in Basque, you need to know 3 simple words:
Ni (pronounced like ‘knee’) = I (Pronouns are not mandatory in Basque, but let’s start out by using them)
(Your Name) = Your name, which I hope you already know
Naiz (pronounced like ‘nice’) = I am
In Basque, verbs always come after nouns and objects, so putting it all together we get:
Ni (your name) naiz



You can also tell someone your nationality using the same sentence structure, substituting your nationality for your name. For example:
Ni amerikanoa naiz = I am American
Ni mexicanoa naiz = I am Mexican
Ni Euskalduna naiz = I am Basque
You can then combine the two sentences using the word ‘eta’, meaning ‘and’:
Ni Sean naiz, eta amerikanoa naiz
Now you know all you need to make a basic introduction in Basque. Eskerrik Asko!

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.
